Tk_TaskSelectPanel

Class Tk_AdditionalTasks.AddListener

  • java.lang.Object
    • Tk_TaskSelectPanel.Tk_AdditionalTasks.AddListener
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.awt.event.ActionListener, java.util.EventListener, javax.swing.event.DocumentListener
    Enclosing class:
    Tk_AdditionalTasks

     class Tk_AdditionalTasks.AddListener
extends java.lang.Object
implements java.awt.event.ActionListener, javax.swing.event.DocumentListener
    This listener implements ActionListener and DocumentListener. The ActionListener is shared by the m_addText field and the m_addTask and m_removeTask JButtons. The DocumentListener is used to pick up changes in the contents of the m_AddText JTextBox. The following action commands are handled: - AddString: Received from the m_addTask button. The action is to add the string in the m_addText JTextField to the m_retiredTasks JList model. - DeleteString: Received from the m_removeTask button. The action is to remove the currently selected item from the m_retiredTasks JList model, and add it to the m_deletedTasks model. - EnterString: Received from the m_addText field when Enter is pressed. The action is to add the string in the m_addText JTextField to the m_retiredTasks JList model. Upon receipt of a DocumentEvent, the m_addTask button is enabled or disabled according to whether there is text in the m_addText JTextField, or if it is empty.
    Author:
    michaelwebster

      • alreadyInList

        protected boolean alreadyInList(java.lang.String name)
        Check if the String name is already in the m_listModel.
        Parameters:
        name - A candidate string for addition to the JList.
        Returns:
        true => name is already in m_listModel - don't add it. false => name is not in m_listModel - ok. to add.
